priorVersion.title: CDISC SEND Rad/Nuc Agent Source Response Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C158122

self.title: CDISC SEND Rad/Nuc Agent Source Response Terminology

definition: Terminology related to the mode by which the radiological or nuclear challenge agent is delivered to the subject.
name: Rad/Nuc Agent Source Response
preferredTerm: CDISC SEND Rad/Nuc Agent Source Response Terminology

terms.definition: A type of particle accelerator that generates ionizing radiation by colliding subatomic particles traveling at high speeds along a curved or circular chamber.
A type of particle accelerator that generates ionizing radiation by colliding subatomic particles traveling at high speeds along a straight chamber.
A device that enables a controlled, self-sustaining nuclear fission reaction with release of energy.
An unstable isotope of an element that decays or disintegrates spontaneously, emitting energy (radiation). (NTI)
A device that exposes samples to X-ray radiation.
